annotation: <history><entry><input>ssh user@ubuntu-vm</input><output>Welcome to Ubuntu 24.04 LTS</output><annotation>Connecting to an Ubuntu virtual machine via SSH.</annotation></entry><entry><input>uname -r</input><output>6.2.0-26-generic</output><annotation>Checking the kernel version of the Ubuntu VM.</annotation></entry><entry><input>mkdir ~/project</input><output></output><annotation>Creating a new directory for a project in the user's home directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>cd ~/project</input><output></output><annotation>Changing to the newly created `project` directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>touch file1.txt file2.txt</input><output></output><annotation>Creating two text files, `file1.txt` and `file2.txt` in the `project` directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>ls</input><output>file1.txt  file2.txt</output><annotation>Listing the contents of the `project` directory to verify the files were created.</annotation></entry><entry><input>echo "Hello World" > file1.txt</input><output></output><annotation>Writing "Hello World" to `file1.txt` using output redirection.</annotation></entry><entry><input>cat file1.txt</input><output>Hello World</output><annotation>Displaying the contents of `file1.txt` to verify the output.</annotation></entry><entry><input>echo "This is file 2" > file2.txt</input><output></output><annotation>Writing "This is file 2" to `file2.txt` using output redirection.</annotation></entry><entry><input>cat file2.txt</input><output>This is file 2</output><annotation>Displaying the contents of `file2.txt` to verify the output.</annotation></entry><entry><input>mv file1.txt ~/Documents/</input><output></output><annotation>Moving `file1.txt` to the `Documents` directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>ls</input><output>file2.txt</output><annotation>Listing the contents of the `project` directory to confirm `file1.txt` has been moved.</annotation></entry><entry><input>ls ~/Documents</input><output>file1.txt</output><annotation>Verifying that `file1.txt` is now in the `Documents` directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>rm file2.txt</input><output></output><annotation>Removing `file2.txt` from the `project` directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>ls</input><output></output><annotation>Confirming that `file2.txt` has been deleted from the `project` directory.</annotation></entry><entry><input>exit</input><output></output><annotation>Exiting the SSH session after completing the file operations.</annotation></entry></history>
